pages.text: A few quality of life things that can be nice to get while you're in the Arid Waste.
Larger dank null storage? Yes please. Available later on in this $(item)simulation$().

When supplied with enough $(item)power$() this nifty gadget can protect nearby blocks from $(item)explosions$(), don't forget to protect the protector.$(br2)You may want more than one protector to spread the load.

pages.title: Stonework Factory
pages.text: The stonework factory can produce Cobblestone, Stone, Gravel, Sand and Silicon when supplied with $(item)power$().
Ender Chests $(item)shares$() inventory with other Ender Chests with the same colorcode.$(br2)Use dyes on the protruding parts on top of the chest to change their color.

This chest can be used to $(item)transport$() items across simulations. For example if you put items in $(item)Chest A$() that is located in the Arid Waste, you can then access those items in from $(item)Chest B$() that is located on the Lunar Plane.$(br2)Use a $(item)Diamond$() on the chest lock to make the chest private.
The $(item)Ender Tank$() function the same way as the $(item)Ender Chests$(), but instead of holding items it holds liquids.

The $(item)Ender Pouch$() can be linked to an $(item)Ender Chest$() so you can access the contents of that chest from anywhere.$(br2)Perfect for $(item)dumping$() items into while out hiking or whatever you cavemen do.

pages.title: Conduits
pages.text: Your ducts are working great but wait until you give this bad boy a spin. $(item)Conduits$() can share the same blockspace with other conduits, so for example an energy conduit can share a blockspace with an item conduit. Nuts!
Two connected powercells can share energy across $(item)simulations$() when supplied with matching $(item)Powercell Cards$().
